channel.title: Why Private Servers today Suck
channel.description:
Disclaimer: This isn't a complaint about the moparscape community, so please read on before locking this thread.
Right now if you check the moparscape status page, the majority of "popular" servers are plain delta-scape sources with no originality except for the name. You may refer to these as "Leeches" or "Delta-Leeches".
The general consensus among these servers, besides the poorly-written lines of code, are to extract money from the consumer(you). Many of these staff members are personal friends of the person who started the server and are often immature and often don't understand that "Great Power comes with Great Responsibility"- Spider Man.
This is why I disagree with the idea of paying to advertise on the moparscape status page, the only way that these servers can get their initial investment back is to constantly update their game with only one thing in mind: profit.
Any "actually" good servers get pushed to the side because the owner often doesn't have the resources to host/promote their server. And then the server just becomes another lost-cause.
I understand that the earnings from the status page go to support good servers that are written off bases like Hyperion and RSDaemon and 317 serv, but how many of these servers serve a practical use beside the constant awe they receive for their well-written lines of code.
It's like how part of the money from every pack of cigarettes you buy goes to health-care for kids. It really doesn't make sense.
So the question is: How do we give more incentive to the working class seasoned-java guru and less incentive to the leecher-skid that uses his parent's credit card to host/promote their pathetic excuse of a server*cough delta-leech*
I personally believe in starting a network between the real programmers and the skids that can host/promote so we get the best of both worlds (ideally). Of course moparscape could get a cut from this to help keep the site running, and to "supposedly" pay people to make good servers.
It just might not be lucrative, but then again private-servers were made in first place for fun not for profit.

item.title: Why Private Servers today Suck
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I agree with most of what you said, but I don’t see where you gave an idea on how to fix it, which is what is needed. If you have an idea I’d be more than happy to hear it.

the elve age:

The reason why Private Servers suck today, is because they find a source. And they look at tutorials on how to do it. People have no idea where to start, when it comes to research, and doing it proper. Ya we have Hyperion, rs377d, and sites like RuneWiki, and information on what means what. But when you start ACTUALLY getting down to the serious stuff, you don’t know where to look, and people are WAY to ignorant to help you.

The information is out there and it is possible to use it without help by figuring it out yourself. How do you think servers like winterlove and rs377d got made in the first place?

It does help if you can program first though. Many people here haven’t really got the right skills for programming (logic, problem solving, maths, whatever) and if we didn’t have the winterlove mess (but instead had a modular, scriptable server) would either be writing scripts or downloading them.

I’m currently writing Apollo (some of you who visit rune server and google have probably heard of it) which is basically Hyperion version 2. It has a much better way of implementing the game scripts and packet/event handling (inspired by the many discussions in the moparscape vet board) which will hopefully solve that problem. The core server is coming along nicely, so soon I’ll be writing content plugins (mining, fishing, woodcutting, etc). When (and if) I ever finish it I am hoping to enter it for mopar’s payment thingy and release it open source :). The goal is for people to simply to be able to download plugins through a system like a linux package manager and fill out a configuration file with their server name/info.

Yes some people will probably moan about ‘oh it is easy for leechers like that’ but I don’t really care. That kind of attitude (keeping stuff to yourself) has harmed server development imho and we are in the current state with a load of crap here instead of a proper, stable server which actually works. I only ever started writing my own servers (like Apollo, Hyperion, rs2hd, Shard) because I just wanted a decent server for me and friends (and of course, no decent servers existed). If one had I probably wouldn’t be involved and would probably forgotten all about RuneScape private servers by now :p.

Anyway I have realised I am going way too off-topic and after re-reading have realised that some doesn’t make that much sense (and promoting Apollo like that sounds like moparisthebest promoting Cherokee :P)… but basically yes I agree in general with the points made by most people in this thread.
[/quote]

Sounds good, I’m looking forward to it being completed so I can finally pay someone for a great server, make sure to let me know via PM when it’s ready.

Read full topic

item.title: Why Private Servers today Suck
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:27, topic:358902”][quote author=JaydenD12 link=topic=455402.msg3337806#msg3337806 date=1284092492]

Then do something about it.

brb releasin epic framwurks

We should care about how player/NPC updating is done - that is top priority.

Yeah, but most of the people that are involved with rsps don’t give a fuck about the core elements.

Edit:

Heres the 317 player updating procedure, documented, by Lin;

http://uppit.com/n1slirdumoak/317_Player_Updating_Procedure.txt
[/quote]Ya, there’s my badly documented updating procedure, which I didn’t update after I successfully got player updating done. I only wrote that so I would have an idea of what exactly I was doing, not for other people to use.[/quote]
By the way, iirc the 0x400 mask is forced movement.

Read full topic

item.title: Why Private Servers today Suck
item.dc:creator: @jensie jensie
item.description:
@jensie wrote:

[quote=“theUnforgiven, post:33, topic:358902”]I’m curious do you guys prefer the crappy unique servers that came out around 07-08 based on czar or the generic delta bases with poorly-colored customs and dragon claws that one hit ko?[/quote]I agree with Lin: I prefer the fast-lvling servers with a decent amount of players. That said, I haven’t played a server since '07.

Read full topic

item.title: Why Private Servers today Suck
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“theUnforgiven, post:33, topic:358902”]I’m curious do you guys prefer the crappy unique servers that came out around 07-08 based on czar or the generic delta bases with poorly-colored customs and dragon claws that one hit ko?[/quote]Honestly, the best ones to play are the ones that offer a challenge with plenty to do (Like RuneScape remakes) or the total opposite of that, where its crazy easy in the Varrock bank and training room with PKing all around. I prefer the second one, since there used to be a variety and after you maxed on one, you went on another server to find more creativity and repeat the cycle for different rewards.

Read full topic

item.title: Why Private Servers today Suck
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:22, topic:358902”]guys guys guys, i have monitored rs dev a bit, sure its unstable, but the real cause to creating a private server is to have a good player base, EVERYTHING is about players. when you have a pool of 200 shit servers on vps that crash every few hours with immature idiots hosting it, that have the enthusiasm and excitement we all get when we were 12 and feel we accomplished something, they tend to ‘get the word out’ by spamming, screaming and doing other forms of advertising little shitdicks would do.

The smart, mature ones who sit at the back, create a nice server and know that they gotta deal with doing stability, then content, don’t get the attention they deserve, they understand awhile after that they’re server can’t compete against these other very bad servers simply because they are unnoticed, or nobody cares that they are 100% stable with 75% of the content other servers have, it is and always will be CONTENT CONTENT CONTENT for the RS2 playerbase (young teens)

We don’t really have this problem over in the RSC section, mainly because a good amount of us are much older (due to us playing RSC when we were young teens, and that’s damn old now that were all adults)

who wants to say im wrong??[/quote]

ur right and thats y i only play rsc

Read full topic

item.title: Why Private Servers today Suck
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

I have a suggestion. Don’t use a base. If you want a stable and reliable server which is easy to edit you’re going to have to make it yourself.

item.title: Why Private Servers today Suck
item.dc:creator: @Ace1 Ace.
item.description:
@Ace1 wrote:

Hm, I wonder when the time will come when there will be a stable and reliable source to use, that is extremely easy to edit (talking, as easy as creating things on Delta is). No, I am not saying I support delta, or that I like it, but I find it extremely easy to edit. It’s just a shame that the stability and reliability isn’t as up-to-date with many modern servers.

Anyhow, anybody got any source suggestions for me to use as a base for my server?

P.S: Yes, I already know about stable and reliable sources like Hyperion, so if you were smart and understood this post, you wouldn’t flame me.

Read full topic

[/quote]

Sorry, I could of sworn you said that on msn. I’ll edit my post. But why don’t you sell it?[/quote]Because I don’t really believe in selling projects that aren’t worth selling. I made the server for fun and learning experiences, not for profit, so I won’t sell it.

item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

the elve age:

False. Lin sold his 355 blank(you know what I mean) to Mopar.

Is that for the big one (i.e. a proper server with content) or for the client/server combinations for moparscape 4?

the elve age:

The reason why Private Servers suck today, is because they find a source. And they look at tutorials on how to do it. People have no idea where to start, when it comes to research, and doing it proper. Ya we have Hyperion, rs377d, and sites like RuneWiki, and information on what means what. But when you start ACTUALLY getting down to the serious stuff, you don’t know where to look, and people are WAY to ignorant to help you.

The information is out there and it is possible to use it without help by figuring it out yourself. How do you think servers like winterlove and rs377d got made in the first place?

It does help if you can program first though. Many people here haven’t really got the right skills for programming (logic, problem solving, maths, whatever) and if we didn’t have the winterlove mess (but instead had a modular, scriptable server) would either be writing scripts or downloading them.

I’m currently writing Apollo (some of you who visit rune server and rune locus have probably heard of it) which is basically Hyperion version 2. It has a much better way of implementing the game scripts and packet/event handling (inspired by the many discussions in the moparscape vet board) which will hopefully solve that problem. The core server is coming along nicely, so soon I’ll be writing content plugins (mining, fishing, woodcutting, etc). When (and if) I ever finish it I am hoping to enter it for mopar’s payment thingy and release it open source :). The goal is for people to simply to be able to download plugins through a system like a linux package manager and fill out a configuration file with their server name/info.

Yes some people will probably moan about ‘oh it is easy for leechers like that’ but I don’t really care. That kind of attitude (keeping stuff to yourself) has harmed server development imho and we are in the current state with a load of crap here instead of a proper, stable server which actually works. I only ever started writing my own servers (like Apollo, Hyperion, rs2hd, Shard) because I just wanted a decent server for me and friends (and of course, no decent servers existed). If one had I probably wouldn’t be involved and would probably forgotten all about RuneScape private servers by now :p.

Anyway I have realised I am going way too off-topic and after re-reading have realised that some doesn’t make that much sense (and promoting Apollo like that sounds like moparisthebest promoting Cherokee :P)… but basically yes I agree in general with the points made by most people in this thread.

item.title: Why Private Servers today Suck
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

zoltanman:

Here’s a suggestion, STOP SPOON FEEDING. Just link them to a java tutorial every time they run into a problem.

this +

Lin:

This has been on my mind for ages, and your points are completely true. Good servers do get pushed to the back, and only those rich little brats with their mom’s credit card get to buy a virtual dedicated server and actually get far with their server. This wouldn’t be so bad in most cases, but everyone uses the SAME FUCKING SERVER without actually adding any new content. What’s funny is all those servers have screenshots showing off “features” like killing rock crabs, shitty pest control, PKing, and other crap that was already there in the first place. Hopefully the retards who play these servers are eventually going to realize what they’re wasting their time and money on.

Read full topic

item.description:
@John459 wrote:

They suck because their creators always want to take the easy way out by downloading one(even this is still hard for some of them). No one wants to put any actual effort in because they don’t need to
